brief.text: An implementation-defined namespace

para.text: Members are not traversed and, if traversed for some other reason, they also become implementation-defined.

brief.text: A regular namespace with different filters for members
A symbol that passes the implementation-defined filter

para.text: A symbol that passes the filters and the implementation-defined filter The symbol is implementation defined and should not have a page. Members of an implementation-defined scope should not be traversed. If they are traversed for some other reason, they should also become implementation-defined.

brief.text: A symbol that passes the filters

para.text: The symbol should have a page as usual

brief.text: Child of a regular symbol extracted as regular
Grandchild of a regular symbol extracted as regular
A symbol that passes the see-below filter

para.text: A symbol that passes the filters and the see-below filter. The symbol should have a page as usual but, because it's a scope and not a namespace, the members should not be listed on that page.

brief.text: A function to get an excluded symbol

para.text: When used in a function, only the symbol name should be shown. No links should be generated for this symbol.

brief.text: A function to get an implementation-defined symbol

para.text: When used in a function, the implementation-defined comment should replace the real type.
It's the responsibility of the function documentation to explain the implementation-defined symbol.

brief.text: A function to get a regular symbol

para.text: When used in a function, the symbol should be shown as usual with a link to the page.

brief.text: A function to get a see-below symbol

para.text: When used in a function, the symbol name should be shown as usual. The page for this symbol is what should be different because the synopsis should say "See below" and the members are not listed unless it's a namespace or the symbol has been explicitly used as a dependency elsewhere.

brief.text: A see-below namespace

para.text: All member symbols should become see-below. All members are traversed as see-below.
The documentation page for these symbols should include the see-below comment.

brief.text: Implementation-defined symbol in a see-below namespace

para.text: The symbol does not become see-below because the the implentation-defined filter has precedence over the see-below filter.
Functions using this symbol should explain the implementation-defined nature of the symbol.

brief.text: Regular symbol in a see-below namespace

para.text: The symbol becomes see-below because the whole namespace is see-below.

brief.text: See-below symbol in a see-below namespace

para.text: The symbol becomes see-below because the whole namespace is see-below and because it's explicitly marked as see-below.

brief.text: A function to get a dependency symbol in a see-below namespace

para.text: The symbol should be extracted as a dependency because the exclude filter has precedence over the see-below filter. Only included symbols can be promoted to see-below.
It's the responsibility of the function documentation to explain the dependency.

brief.text: A function to get an implementation-defined symbol in a see-below namespace

para.text: When used in a function, the implementation-defined comment should replace the real type.
It's the responsibility of the function documentation to explain the implementation-defined symbol.

brief.text: Namespace alias to form the dependency on dependency_ns
Namespace alias to form a dependency on the implementation-defined namespace
Namespace alias to form a dependency on the see-below namespace

para.text: The alias should be linked as usual and, because it's a namespace, the members should be listed on the page.

brief.text: An implementation-defined symbol in the global namespace

para.text: The symbol is implementation defined and should not have a page.

brief.text: A regular symbol in the global namespace

para.text: This symbol should have a page as usual.

brief.text: Child of a regular symbol: should be traversed as usual
Grandchild of a regular symbol: should be traversed as usual
A see-below symbol in the global namespace

para.text: This symbol should have a page as usual but, because it's a scope and not a namespace, the members should not be listed on that page.
The synopsis should say "See below".

brief.text: A function to get a dependency symbol on the global namespace

para.text: The symbol should be extracted as a dependency but its members should not be traversed.

brief.text: A function to get an implementation-defined symbol in the global namespace

para.text: When used in a function, the implementation-defined comment should replace the real type.
It's the responsibility of the function documentation to explain the implementation-defined symbol.

brief.text: A function to get a regular symbol in the global namespace

para.text: When used in a function, the symbol should be shown as usual with a link to the page.

brief.text: A function to get a see-below symbol in the global namespace

para.text: When used in a function, the symbol name should be shown as usual. The page for this symbol is what should be different because the synopsis should say "See below" and the members are not listed unless it's a namespace or the symbol has been explicitly used as a dependency elsewhere.
